business.headline: Explained: Why Bharti Airtel shares fell 3% in early trade today At 9:35 am, shares of the company were trading 2.69% lower at Rs 1,816.60 on the Bombay Stock Exchange (BSE).

IndusInd bank shares down 2% after private lender flags interest mistakeIndusInd bank stock opened at Rs 735.95 after having closed at Rs 780.30 in the previous session. The shares have lost 7.29% in the past 5 days, 23.55% over the last 6 months, and 45.48% over the past year.
Sensex, Nifty open lower after yesterday's rally; IndusInd Bank down 3%The BSE Sensex was down 226.18 points to 82,304.56 at 9:20 am, while the NSE Nifty50 fell 67.80 points to trade at 24,994.30.

Stock market today: Sensex, Nifty likely to open higher. Here's whyBoth the Sensex and Nifty touched their highest levels in the last seven months in the last session. So far this week, the Nifty has gained around 4.5% and the BSE Sensex about 4%.
Stocks to watch on May 16: Hyundai, Airtel, IndusInd Bank, BHEL, Bajaj AutoHyundai Motor, BHEL, Delhivery, Emami will announce their earnings for the January-March quarter on Friday.

IndusInd Bank flags Rs 674 crore error as 'incorrectly recorded interest'The bank said its Internal Audit Department (IAD) found that a total of Rs 674 crore was wrongly shown as interest over three quarters in FY 2024-25.
India offered zero-tariff trade deal: Donald TrumpUS President Donald Trump claimed that India has offered the United States a trade deal with "literally zero tariffs".

YES Bank shares jump 21% in 5 days. What investors need to knowSMBC, a part of the Sumitomo Mitsui Financial Group (SMFG), plans to buy the 20% stake from State Bank of India (SBI) and seven private banks, HDFC Bank, ICICI Bank, Kotak Mahindra Bank, Axis Bank, IDFC First Bank, Federal Bank, and Bandhan Bank.

Sensex ends 1,200 points higher, Nifty above 25,000; Tata Motors surges 4%The S&P BSE Sensex surged 1,200.18 points to end at 82,530.74, while the NSE Nifty50 gained 395.60 points to close at 25,062.10.

Donald Trump claims India has offered zero-tariff deal in trade talksSpeaking at a business forum in Qatar, Trump said, "India has offered us a deal where basically they are willing to literally charge us no tariff." He didn't provide further details, and there was no immediate response from the Indian government.

Planning a personal loan? 7 hidden charges you must know aboutMany people only look at the interest rate when taking a personal loan. But there are several other costs that can add up. Knowing these charges helps you plan better, avoid surprises, and even negotiate some of them with the bank.

Sensex jumps 1,300 points: Why is stock market rising today?As of 2:38 p.m., the S&P BSE Sensex had gained 1,217.88 points to reach 82,548.44, and the NSE Nifty50 had climbed 410.57 points to 25,077.50.

entertainment.headline: Diljit Dosanjh says Shakira's wardrobe malfunction affected his Met Gala entryDiljit Dosanjh recently opened up about Shakira's unexpected wardrobe malfunction just before her Met Gala appearance this year. In a newly released YouTube vlog, the singer shared behind-the-scenes moments from his debut at the prestigious event.

Mouni Roy addresses social media hate, Palak Tiwari reflects on celebrity bashingActors Mouni Roy and Palak Tiwari talked about social media hate. The two talked about navigating through the relentless trolling, especially on one's appearance.

'Stree' actor Vijay Raaz acquitted in 2020 sexual harassment caseActor Vijay Raaz has been acquitted of all sexual harassment and stalking charges. He was accused of molesting a crew member during the shooting of Vidya Balan's 'Sherni'.

James Bond actor Joe Don Baker dies at 89Joe Don Baker, acclaimed actor of Walking Tall and three James Bond films, has died at 89. A versatile performer across film and TV, he retired in 2012 and leaves behind a celebrated legacy.

Alex G Announces 2025 North American tour with Nilüfer YanyaAlex G will embark on a 16-city North American tour in fall 2025, joined by Nilüfer Yanya. Highlights include major venues like Radio City and Ryman. Tickets go on sale May 20.

Lollapalooza 2025 full lineup and set times released: What to knowLollapalooza 2025 returns to Chicago's Grant Park July 31–August 3 with a diverse lineup, including Olivia Rodrigo, Twice, and A$AP Rocky. Full daily schedule and tickets now available online.

R&B Star Chris Brown formally charged over alleged nightclub incident in LondonSinger Chris Brown was arrested in Manchester over a 2023 London nightclub assault. He allegedly attacked music producer Abe Diaw. No formal charges yet; the case may affect his UK tour.

Human remains found near Taylor Swift's mansion in US amid serial killer scareA human leg bone was found near Taylor Swift's Rhode Island mansion, alarming locals and fuelling serial killer fears amid similar cases across the Northeast. Police say no foul play is suspected.

Scarlett Johansson reacts to Oscars snubbing 'impossible movie' Avengers EndgameActress Scarlett Johansson has reacted to MCU's Avengers: Endgame getting snubbed at Oscars 2020. She called the sci-fi action-thriller an 'impossible movie.'

Chris Brown arrested over 2023 bottle attack in London nightclubSinger Chris Brown was arrested in Manchester on suspicion of assaulting music producer Abe Diaw with a tequila bottle at a London nightclub in 2023. The incident has sparked a police investigation and a $16 million civil lawsuit.

Huma Qureshi opens up on ageism, gatekeeping in BollywoodActor Huma Qureshi was one of the other guest speakers at India Today's Indo-UAE Conclave, where she spoke about the changing landscape in cinema and how script-writing has evolved over the years.

Everything is stalled: Kalki Koechlin says Bollywood is in recession phaseActor Kalki Koechlin has called out a recession in Bollywood, highlighting stalled projects, job losses, and a creative crisis. She stressed the need for the industry to adapt to changing audience habits and explore new formats like VR.
DD Next Level makers remove song lines after legal controversyThe controversial lyrics from 'Kissa 47' in Santhanam's 'DD Next Level' have been removed following legal trouble.

'Ek Do Teen' to being evergreen: Madhuri Dixit's legacy as legit Bollywood superstarMadhuri Dixit is one name that resonates with the hearts of many even today. With an ever-evolving Bollywood where fame is often fleeting and stardom gets redefined with every Friday release, Madhuri Dixit stands as a rare constant. On her 58th birthday today, read to find out how she is the last of superstar left.

Radhika Apte's award-winning film Sister Midnight set for India releaseRadhika Apte's internationally acclaimed film, 'Sister Midnight, is set to release in India on May 23. Directed by Karan Kandhari, the film has been honoured at Cannes Film Festival, BAFTA and Fantastic Fest.

Don't have a choice: Robert De Niro answers if he fears death at 81Actor Robert De Niro opened up on mortality at the ongoing Cannes International Film Festival 2025. When asked whether he is afraid of death, De Niro answered poetically, referring to the 'choices' and 'embracing life'.

Mission Impossible 8 X review: 'King' Tom Cruise owns franchise's bestTom Cruise aces the action sequences, and delivers probably the best of the 'Mission: Impossible' franchise as early reviews for 'Mission: Impossible-The Final Reckoning' kick in on social media.

Don't call me random: Kusha Kapila schools memer for mocking her Cannes appearanceKusha Kapila strongly responded to a viral meme that mocked her Cannes appearance, defending her presence and identity as a creator. She clarified misconceptions about influencer roles at the festival and asked for basic respect instead of online dismissal.

Cannes represents cinematic royalty: Shalini Passi on her red carpet debutArtist and philanthropist Shalini Passi is set to make her first appearance at the Cannes Film Festival. Her participation highlights the fusion of contemporary creativity and cultural expression on a prestigious international stage.

general news.headline: Defence budget may get Rs 50,000 crore push post Operation Sindoor: SourcesThe additional spending will be directed towards the purchase of new weapons and ammunition, as well as technology, following Operation Sindoor.

In a 1st, Jaishankar speaks to Taliban minister, thanks for condemning J&K attackIn the first political-level contact between India and Afghanistan since the Taliban seized power in Kabul in August 2021, External Affairs Minister S Jaishankar spoke with the country's acting Foreign Minister over the phone and thanked him for condemning the Pahalgam attacks.

Erdogan's daughter not owner, we are not Turkish: Aviation firm on losing clearanceCelebi Aviation's security clearance was revoked by Indian authorities following tensions with Turkey after Operation Sindoor. The company has denied any political affiliations or Turkish ownership.

Apple would be more concerned about...: India on Trump's advice to Tim CookTrump said he told Apple CEO Tim Cook that he was unhappy with Apple building iPhones in India. Following the remark made by Trump, a government official said that Apple would be more concerned about where they would find manufacturing competitiveness.

Ashwin joins Test captaincy debate, backs his spin twin to lead India for 2 yearsFormer India spinner R. Ashwin has weighed in on the India Test captaincy debate, backing his spin twin Ravindra Jadeja to lead the men's Test team for the next two years.

News Menu, May 16: Rajnath Singh at Bhuj airbase, Rahul Gandhi's Bihar defianceIndia Today's May 16 news menu serves a spicy platter of headlines -- from an Indo-Pak missile clash and Rajnath Singh's Bhuj rally, to storm over controversial remarks on Colonel Sofiya Qureshi and Rahul Gandhi's Bihar outreach.
India, Pak extend ceasefire till May 18; agree to continue reducing alert levelsIndia and Pakistan have decided to extend the ceasefire understanding and reduce the alertness level.

Trump under fire as US military strategist slams $1 billion IMF bailout for PakEx-Pentagon adviser Michael Rubin slammed the IMF's $1B bailout to Pakistan, calling it aid to a "terror-addled, pro-China regime." He said it undermines Trump, bails out China, and rewards Pakistan's terrorism-linked actions against India.

Human remains found near Taylor Swift's mansion in US amid serial killer scareA human leg bone was found near Taylor Swift's Rhode Island mansion, alarming locals and fuelling serial killer fears amid similar cases across the Northeast. Police say no foul play is suspected.
An Architectural Trail in GujaratPress Release | Vadnagar has substantial remains of its ancient Buddhist heritage.

Yogi Adityanath didn't listen to me: Samajwadi MP on Vyomika Singh caste remarkSamajwadi Party MP Ramgopal Yadav accused BJP of targeting officers based on caste and religion, alleging CM Yogi shared his remarks without context. He defended his comments by citing bias in law enforcement and governance.

Defence Minister Rajnath Singh to visit Bhuj airbase todayIndia Pakistan Conflict Live Updates: Today marks the sixth day since India and Pakistan reached an understanding to cease hostilities, bringing an end to the heightened military tensions that had escalated following the April 22 Pahalgam terrorist attack and India's subsequent retaliatory Operation Sindoor. Following a meeting between the Directors General of Military Operations (DGMOs) of India and Pakistan after the ceasefire, both armies firmed up the arrangement to halt military actions. The Indian Army said it will pursue confidence-building measures to reduce the 'alertness level' in line with the understanding. Stay tuned to IndiaToday.in for all the latest updates.

Exclusive: India fired 15 BrahMos missiles to cripple Pakistan's air defenceThe Air Force used pilotless target aircraft to provoke Pakistani radars and air defence systems into action. Once they were activated, India deployed drones to disable and damage those systems. This move paved the way for further missile attacks using BrahMos and Scalp cruise missiles.

Political storm in Telangana over women washing Miss World contestants' feetA video of Telangana women washing Miss World contestants' feet at temples has sparked political outrage. Opposition parties slammed the Congress-led state government, calling it humiliating and disrespectful to women's dignity and self-respect.

INDIA alliance is frayed: P Chidambaram expresses concerns over bloc's futureThe former Union finance minister warned that the INDIA bloc was fighting against a "formidable machinery", which must be fought on all fronts.

Tamil Nadu Board announces Class 10,11 result declared. Here's direct link to check scoresThe Tamil Nadu SSLC Class 10th, 11th results for 2025 have been declared, reflecting a strong pass percentage of 93.8%. Students can soon access their results through the official website once the link is activated.

Erdogan unmoved by boycott-Turkey calls, backs true brother PakistanEven as Indians and businesses expressed outrage over Turkey's military support to Pakistan during its armed confrontation with India, Turkish President Erdogan doubled down on backing Islamabad. He assured Pakistani PM Sharif that Turkey would stand by Pakistan in good times and bad.

With Zelezny in his corner, fit-again Neeraj Chopra aims to join 90m club in DohaInjury-free and working with legendary coach Jan Železný, Neeraj Chopra is eyeing the elusive 90m mark as he kicks off his 2025 season in Doha. The two-time Olympic medallist is confident and in form, looking to join the elite club at a venue famed for big javelin throws.

Ex-Army man killed, body chopped into 6 pieces by wife, lover in UP; 4 arrestedThe Uttar Pradesh police found the man's body parts at different locations, while his head is still missing. Four people, including his wife and her lover, have been arrested.

Why Ranthambore tigress Kankati's fate hangs in the balanceTwo human kills in quick succession later, forest officials debate if shifting the sub-adult tigress out of the national park is a plausible option

Pakistan's only gain from war with India — a Comical AliIf Baghdad had Comical Ali, Islamabad now has his spiritual successor — complete with Photoshop skills and phantom drones. Say hello to Pakistan's newest discovery: disinformation, delivered with a straight face by Lt Gen Ahmed Sharif Chaudhry.

Leak reveals iPhone Fold display details, punch-hole camera is almost certainThe upcoming iPhone Fold is rumoured to ditch the dynamic island. Here is what the new rumour indicates about the iPhone Fold's display.

Nothing was done, only show-off: Congress MLA doubts impact of Operation SindoorThe government said that nine terror launch pads were destroyed and around 100 terrorists were killed in Operation Sindoor, a claim contended by some opposition parties, including the Congress.

Kashmiri waiter in Doha thanked Trump for peace, claims White House Press SecretaryWhite House Press Secretary Karoline Leavitt credited President Trump for brokering an India-Pakistan ceasefire, citing a Kashmiri waiter's gratitude, despite Indian officials denying US involvement.

Diljit Dosanjh says Shakira's wardrobe malfunction affected his Met Gala entryDiljit Dosanjh recently opened up about Shakira's unexpected wardrobe malfunction just before her Met Gala appearance this year. In a newly released YouTube vlog, the singer shared behind-the-scenes moments from his debut at the prestigious event.

sports.headline: Swim David: Watch RCB star enjoy rainy evening in Bengaluru before IPL resumptionIPL 2025: Australian batter Tim David enjoyed the rainy weather in Bengaluru as he was seen swimming on the ground covers at the M Chinnaswamy Stadium.

Ashwin joins Test captaincy debate, backs his spin twin to lead India for 2 yearsFormer India spinner R. Ashwin has weighed in on the India Test captaincy debate, backing his spin twin Ravindra Jadeja to lead the men's Test team for the next two years.

Jannik Sinner in elite company with Big 3 after hammering Casper RudeItalian Open 2025: Jannik Sinner put on a dominating performance after beating Casper Ruud 6-0, 6-1 in the quarterfinal. He will next face Tommy Paul in the semis.

With Zelezny in his corner, fit-again Neeraj Chopra aims to join 90m club in DohaInjury-free and working with legendary coach Jan Železný, Neeraj Chopra is eyeing the elusive 90m mark as he kicks off his 2025 season in Doha. The two-time Olympic medallist is confident and in form, looking to join the elite club at a venue famed for big javelin throws.

Barcelona completes treble with 28th La Liga titleBarcelona won their 28th La Liga title after beating Espanyol 2-0 on Thursday at the RCDE Stadium on the back of goals from Fermin Lopez and Lamine Yamal.

Several fans injured after being hit by a car before Barcelona derbyA female driver was arrested by Catalonia's police force after her car hit several Espanyol supporters before the Catalan derby against Barcelona in LaLiga.

Messi named in Argentina probable squad for 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiersArgentina have named captain Lionel Messi in their probable squad for the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Chile and Colombia, the national team announced on Thursday.

Ravi Shastri confirms Virat Kohli spoke to him before Test retirementFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri said he asked Virat Kohli a couple of questions when the former captain called to discuss his retirement from Test cricket. Kohli's responses, he said, made it clear that the 36-year-old was done with the longest format of the game.

BCCI wants to adopt Olympic sports; Government mulling approval for OCI athletesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is considering adopting two to three Olympic sports in a boost to the Sports Ministry's plan to establish specialised Olympic training centres.

Neeraj Chopra at Doha Diamond League: When and where to watch javelin eventDoha Diamond League 2025: Neeraj Chopra will look to continue his good run in a star-studded men's javelin field in Doha. India's Kishore Jena will also be in action on Friday.

Nick Kyrgios to return to French Open after eight years in men's doublesAustralian tennis star Nick Kyrgios will make his French Open comeback after eight years when he will partner his compatriot Jordan Thompson to participate in the men's doubles tournament.

Messi named in Argentina probable squad for 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiersArgentina have named captain Lionel Messi in their probable squad for the 2026 FIFA World Cup qualifiers against Chile and Colombia, the national team announced on Thursday.

Ravi Shastri confirms Virat Kohli spoke to him before Test retirementFormer India head coach Ravi Shastri said he asked Virat Kohli a couple of questions when the former captain called to discuss his retirement from Test cricket. Kohli's responses, he said, made it clear that the 36-year-old was done with the longest format of the game.

BCCI wants to adopt Olympic sports; Government mulling approval for OCI athletesThe Board of Control for Cricket in India (BCCI) is considering adopting two to three Olympic sports in a boost to the Sports Ministry's plan to establish specialised Olympic training centres.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.
